title: Question about provisionals
body: I recently finished my placement matches and got placed in Silver II. What I found strange was I never encountered any bronze players throughout those 10 games, not a single one. I would check after every game who I got matched with. They were all either high silver, low gold, or unranked players. Why is it that I was never matched with bronze? I doubt it has to do with my normal MMR since it has a pretty bad win loss ratio. Can someone explain?

replies.body: If you're account has no ranked games played on it, it sticks you at an MMR of what it determines to be the average, which I believe is Silver 1. So, naturally, during your provisionals, you're going to be playing with/against people who are within a reasonable MMR range of Silver 1.
But why do so many of my friends get matched with bronze or end up in bronze if that's the case? They had no ranked games in the past, either.

The way I understand it is that it's highly influenced by the amount of games you win in your provisionals, and what order you win those games in. I may be wrong though, that's just what I've determined from the other conversations I've seen on the topic.
Its because when u were playing ur 10 placement matches u still have an mmr. Since u got silver 2 u obviously won about 7 games out of 10 and were versing silvers/ golds for a reason

I won 5 out of 10 games, actually. Yesterday I kind of rushed to finish it and I regret doing that so much because I was doing nicely with 5-2 win loss but finished the last 3 games yesterday and lost them all. If only I were patient enough.. ;_;
Thanks for the replies, guys, I think I've got it now.
Every account starts at 1200MMR, which is about silver3.

Hey there Azureocereus,

Assuming we're talking about your placement matches for promos from a fresh level 30 account without any previous ranked history on it I provide the following answer.

A fresh level 30 account as an MMR reflective of Silver MMR (1200) This is the MMR you will have in your first provisional. You will almost certainly be placed with Silvers. Depending on the outcome of that match you will be placed accordingly due to the MMR points you will receive following the match. For each win you receive an estimate average of 50 MMR points. Same for each loss. The best equation I can give you is:

BASE MMR (1200) + (ranked wins x 50) - (ranked loses x 50) = Placement MMR

If you win your first ranked game you will be placed with higher MMR summoners. Considering you were already placed with silvers in your first match you will more than likely continue playing with silvers. In my second provisional match I was playing with golds. The more you win the higher the players you will be placed with. The more you lose, the lower they will be. So it is entirely possible for you to never encounter bronze players during provisionals.

If you are playing provisionals with previous ranked history then the principle is still the same. Only the equation changes for your placement MMR.

(existing MMR [available estimate at OPGG] + base MMR [1200] / 2) + (ranked wins x 50) - (ranked loses x 50) = placement MMR

Hope this helps.

Kind Regards,
